posts.name: Alex Gonzales
posts.cooked: I need help finding videos or places to learn java programming and code so that I can get started typing for my teams robot.

posts.name: Josh Buker
posts.cooked:
Here are some of the resources I used when first starting out.

Best place is just the wpilib docs and other sources similar.

Welcome to the FIRST ¬Æ Robotics Competition Control System Documentation! This site contains everything you need to know for programming a competition robot! Community translations can be found in ...

This is a general beginners Java course that explains all the key concepts one would need for FRC programming, that being data types, methods, classes.

Alternatively, you can take this free Udemy course which I have done recently and it is very good. Since it is split up into sections, it doesn‚Äôt seem as daunting of a task.

This playlist is a bit outdated, with old syntax and commands, but the concepts are the same so it will still serve as a good place to start.

If you look around a bit, the resources out there are endless, but hope this gives a good starting point or at least reference to what I used to learn Java and FRC.

link_counts.title: FIRST Robotics Competition Control System ‚Äî FIRST Robotics Competition documentation
